channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Generalizable Human Gaussians from Single-View Image
item.description: To this end, we propose single-view generalizable Human Gaussian model (HGM), a diffusion-guided framework for 3D human modeling from a single image.

item.title: CARES: A Comprehensive Benchmark of Trustworthiness in Medical Vision Language Models
item.description: Artificial intelligence has significantly impacted medical applications, particularly with the advent of Medical Large Vision Language Models (Med-LVLMs), sparking optimism for the future of automated and personalized healthcare.

item.title: Generalizing to Unseen Domains in Diabetic Retinopathy with Disentangled Representations
item.description: Subsequently, to improve the robustness of the decoupled representations, class and domain prototypes are employed to interpolate the disentangled representations while data-aware weights are designed to focus on rare classes and domains.

item.title: Synthesizing Efficient Data with Diffusion Models for Person Re-Identification Pre-Training
item.description: In this paper, we present a novel paradigm Diffusion-ReID to efficiently augment and generate diverse images based on known identities without requiring any cost of data collection and annotation.

item.title: Compute Better Spent: Replacing Dense Layers with Structured Matrices
item.description: We show that different structures often require drastically different initialization scales and learning rates, which are crucial to performance, especially as models scale.

item.title: MaskLID: Code-Switching Language Identification through Iterative Masking
item.description: This method uses the LID itself to identify the features that require masking and does not rely on any external resource.

item.title: UEMM-Air: A Synthetic Multi-modal Dataset for Unmanned Aerial Vehicle Object Detection
item.description: To this end, we propose a synthetic multi-modal UAV-based object detection dataset, UEMM-Air.

item.title: How Far Can Transformers Reason? The Locality Barrier and Inductive Scratchpad
item.description: Can Transformers predict new syllogisms by composing established ones?

item.title: MOSA: Music Motion with Semantic Annotation Dataset for Cross-Modal Music Processing
item.description: In cross-modal music processing, translation between visual, auditory, and semantic content opens up new possibilities as well as challenges.

item.title: LLM Dataset Inference: Did you train on my dataset?
item.description: Instead, we propose a new dataset inference method to accurately identify the datasets used to train large language models.

item.title: EpiLearn: A Python Library for Machine Learning in Epidemic Modeling
item.description: EpiLearn is a Python toolkit developed for modeling, simulating, and analyzing epidemic data.

item.title: Husky: A Unified, Open-Source Language Agent for Multi-Step Reasoning
item.description: Despite using 7B models, Husky matches or even exceeds frontier LMs such as GPT-4 on these tasks, showcasing the efficacy of our holistic approach in addressing complex reasoning problems.

item.title: A Dual-View Approach to Classifying Radiology Reports by Co-Training
item.description: Radiology report analysis provides valuable information that can aid with public health initiatives, and has been attracting increasing attention from the research community.

item.title: Towards Real-World Efficiency: Domain Randomization in Reinforcement Learning for Pre-Capture of Free-Floating Moving Targets by Autonomous Robots
item.description: In this research, we introduce a deep reinforcement learning-based control approach to address the intricate challenge of the robotic pre-grasping phase under microgravity conditions.

item.title: LINGOLY: A Benchmark of Olympiad-Level Linguistic Reasoning Puzzles in Low-Resource and Extinct Languages
item.description: In this paper, we present the LingOly benchmark, a novel benchmark for advanced reasoning abilities in large language models.

item.title: ThaiCoref: Thai Coreference Resolution Dataset
item.description: In this work, we introduce ThaiCoref, a dataset for Thai coreference resolution.

item.title: FLEUR: An Explainable Reference-Free Evaluation Metric for Image Captioning Using a Large Multimodal Model
item.description: By leveraging a large multimodal model, FLEUR can evaluate the caption against the image without the need for reference captions, and provide the explanation for the assigned score.

item.title: GraphStorm: all-in-one graph machine learning framework for industry applications
item.description: GraphStorm has the following desirable properties: (a) Easy to use: it can perform graph construction and model training and inference with just a single command; (b) Expert-friendly: GraphStorm contains many advanced GML modeling techniques to handle complex graph data and improve model performance; (c) Scalable: every component in GraphStorm can operate on graphs with billions of nodes and can scale model training and inference to different hardware without changing any code.

item.title: Monkey See, Monkey Do: Harnessing Self-attention in Motion Diffusion for Zero-shot Motion Transfer
item.description: Given the remarkable results of motion synthesis with diffusion models, a natural question arises: how can we effectively leverage these models for motion editing?

item.title: UMBRELA: UMbrela is the (Open-Source Reproduction of the) Bing RELevance Assessor
item.description: Copious amounts of relevance judgments are necessary for the effective training and accurate evaluation of retrieval systems.

item.title: Vript: A Video Is Worth Thousands of Words
item.description: Vriptor is also a powerful model capable of end-to-end generation of dense and detailed captions for long videos.

item.title: Safety Alignment Should Be Made More Than Just a Few Tokens Deep
item.description: We refer to this issue as shallow safety alignment.

item.title: Building Bridges: A Dataset for Evaluating Gender-Fair Machine Translation into German
item.description: The translation of gender-neutral person-referring terms (e. g., the students) is often non-trivial.

item.title: How Useful is Intermittent, Asynchronous Expert Feedback for Bayesian Optimization?
item.description: The gathered feedback is used to learn a Bayesian preference model that can readily be incorporated into the BO thread, to steer its exploration-exploitation process.

item.title: Autoregressive Model Beats Diffusion: Llama for Scalable Image Generation
item.description: (3) A text-conditional image generation model with 775M parameters, from two-stage training on LAION-COCO and high aesthetics quality images, demonstrating competitive performance of visual quality and text alignment.

item.title: fSEAD: a Composable FPGA-based Streaming Ensemble Anomaly Detection Library
item.description: Machine learning ensembles combine multiple base models to produce a more accurate output.

item.title: Is Value Functions Estimation with Classification Plug-and-play for Offline Reinforcement Learning?
item.description: In deep Reinforcement Learning (RL), value functions are typically approximated using deep neural networks and trained via mean squared error regression objectives to fit the true value functions.

item.title: Unveiling the Safety of GPT-4o: An Empirical Study using Jailbreak Attacks
item.description: The recent release of GPT-4o has garnered widespread attention due to its powerful general capabilities.

item.title: MATES: Model-Aware Data Selection for Efficient Pretraining with Data Influence Models
item.description: In this paper, we introduce model-aware data selection with data influence models (MATES), where a data influence model continuously adapts to the evolving data preferences of the pretraining model and then selects the data most effective for the current pretraining progress.

item.title: Recurrent Context Compression: Efficiently Expanding the Context Window of LLM
item.description: To extend the context length of Transformer-based large language models (LLMs) and improve comprehension capabilities, we often face limitations due to computational resources and bounded memory storage capacity.

item.title: Neural-g: A Deep Learning Framework for Mixing Density Estimation
item.description: Mixing (or prior) density estimation is an important problem in machine learning and statistics, especially in empirical Bayes $g$-modeling where accurately estimating the prior is necessary for making good posterior inferences.

item.title: Multicam-SLAM: Non-overlapping Multi-camera SLAM for Indirect Visual Localization and Navigation
item.description: The proposed Muticam-SLAM includes a unique multi-camera model, a multi-keyframes structure, and several parallel SLAM threads.

item.title: Diving into Underwater: Segment Anything Model Guided Underwater Salient Instance Segmentation and A Large-scale Dataset
item.description: Underwater salient instance segmentation is a foundational and vital step for various underwater vision tasks, which often suffer from low segmentation accuracy due to the complex underwater circumstances and the adaptive ability of models.

item.title: Language Models are Alignable Decision-Makers: Dataset and Application to the Medical Triage Domain
item.description: Such decisions may be guided by different attributes that can be used to characterize an individual's decision.

item.title: Synth-SBDH: A Synthetic Dataset of Social and Behavioral Determinants of Health for Clinical Text
item.description: Social and behavioral determinants of health (SBDH) play a crucial role in health outcomes and are frequently documented in clinical text.

item.title: Diffusion-RPO: Aligning Diffusion Models through Relative Preference Optimization
item.description: Aligning large language models with human preferences has emerged as a critical focus in language modeling research.

item.title: VillagerAgent: A Graph-Based Multi-Agent Framework for Coordinating Complex Task Dependencies in Minecraft
item.description: In this paper, we aim to evaluate multi-agent systems against complex dependencies, including spatial, causal, and temporal constraints.

item.title: Binarized Diffusion Model for Image Super-Resolution
item.description: Nonetheless, due to the model structure and the multi-step iterative attribute of DMs, existing binarization methods result in significant performance degradation.

item.title: The BiGGen Bench: A Principled Benchmark for Fine-grained Evaluation of Language Models with Language Models
item.description: To overcome these limitations, we introduce the BiGGen Bench, a principled generation benchmark designed to thoroughly evaluate nine distinct capabilities of LMs across 77 diverse tasks.

item.title: Scaling Graph Convolutions for Mobile Vision
item.description: To compete with existing mobile architectures, MobileViG introduces Sparse Vision Graph Attention (SVGA), a fast token-mixing operator based on the principles of GNNs.

item.title: Peer Review as A Multi-Turn and Long-Context Dialogue with Role-Based Interactions
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have demonstrated wide-ranging applications across various fields and have shown significant potential in the academic peer-review process.

item.title: MoPS: Modular Story Premise Synthesis for Open-Ended Automatic Story Generation
item.description: In supplementary materials, we provide the MoPS code suite, along with 7. 6k generated premises and 1k extended stories.

item.title: STARLING: Self-supervised Training of Text-based Reinforcement Learning Agent with Large Language Models
item.description: In this work, we introduce an interactive environment for self-supervised RL, STARLING, for text-based games that bootstraps the text-based RL agents with automatically generated games (based on the seed set of game ideas) to boost the performance and generalization capabilities to reach a goal of the target environment.

item.title: QGEval: A Benchmark for Question Generation Evaluation
item.description: However, there is a lack of unified evaluation criteria, which hampers the development of both QG technologies and automatic evaluation methods.

item.title: A DeNoising FPN With Transformer R-CNN for Tiny Object Detection
item.description: Second, based on the two-stage framework, we replace the obsolete R-CNN detector with a novel Trans R-CNN detector to focus on the representation of tiny objects with self-attention.

item.title: BOSC: A toolbox for aerial imagery mapping
item.description: Accurate and efficient label of aerial images is essential for informed decision-making and resource allocation, whether in identifying crop types or delineating land-use patterns.

item.title: Attention as a Hypernetwork
item.description: Using the framework of attention as a hypernetwork we further propose a simple modification of multi-head linear attention that strengthens the ability for compositional generalization on a range of abstract reasoning tasks.

item.title: SinkLoRA: Enhanced Efficiency and Chat Capabilities for Long-Context Large Language Models
item.description: However, LongLoRA is still not as efficient as vanilla attention, reaching only 39\% of the perplexity improvement compared to full attention.

item.title: Anomaly Multi-classification in Industrial Scenarios: Transferring Few-shot Learning to a New Task
item.description: In industrial scenarios, it is crucial not only to identify anomalous items but also to classify the type of anomaly.

item.title: Flow of Reasoning: Efficient Training of LLM Policy with Divergent Thinking
item.description: FoR formulates multi-step LLM reasoning as a Markovian flow from an initial state to terminal states.
